document.title: MDX Plugins Showcase
document.description: Demonstrating remark and rehype plugin capabilities

body.raw:
# MDX Plugins Exploration :rocket:

## Table of Contents

## Markdown Basics

This document showcases various markdown and plugin features:

- **Bold text** and _italic text_
- [Hyperlinks](https://example.com)
- Inline `code` highlighting

## GitHub Flavored Markdown (remark-gfm)

### Task Lists

- [x] Complete MDX tutorial
- [ ] Explore more plugins
- [ ] Write advanced content

### Tables

| Feature  | Support | Notes                 |
| -------- | ------- | --------------------- |
| Markdown | ✅      | Native support        |
| MDX      | ✅      | Enhanced capabilities |
| Plugins  | ✅      | Extensible            |

## Code Blocks with Syntax Highlighting (rehype-prism)

### JavaScript Example

```javascript
function demonstratePlugins(features) {
  return features.map((feature) => {
    console.log(`Exploring: ${feature}`);
    return `Enhanced ${feature}`;
  });
}

const pluginFeatures = ["markdown", "syntax", "transformation"];
demonstratePlugins(pluginFeatures);
```

### Python Example

```python
def markdown_magic(content):
    """Transform markdown with ease"""
    return content.upper()

# Plugin-powered transformation
result = markdown_magic("mdx is awesome")
print(result)
```

## Emoji Support (remark-emoji)

Coding can be fun! :computer: :smile:

Programming is an art :paintbrush: and a science :microscope:

## Headings with Automatic Slugs (rehype-slug)

Headings automatically get unique identifiers for easy linking.

### Nested Heading Example

You can directly link to this section using its generated slug.

## Custom React Component Integration

import CustomAlert from "../components/CustomAlert";

<CustomAlert type="info">
  MDX allows seamless React and Markdown integration!
</CustomAlert>

## Code Block Line Numbers

Notice how our code blocks now have line numbers thanks to rehype-prism.

## Conclusion

Plugins transform markdown from simple text formatting to a powerful documentation system! :tada:
body.html:
MDX Plugins Exploration :rocket:

Table of Contents

Markdown Basics

This document showcases various markdown and plugin features:

  • Bold text and italic text
  • Hyperlinks
  • Inline code highlighting

GitHub Flavored Markdown (remark-gfm)

Task Lists

  • [x] Complete MDX tutorial
  • [ ] Explore more plugins
  • [ ] Write advanced content

Tables

| Feature | Support | Notes | | -------- | ------- | --------------------- | | Markdown | ✅ | Native support | | MDX | ✅ | Enhanced capabilities | | Plugins | ✅ | Extensible |

Code Blocks with Syntax Highlighting (rehype-prism)

JavaScript Example

function demonstratePlugins(features) {
  return features.map((feature) => {
    console.log(`Exploring: ${feature}`);
    return `Enhanced ${feature}`;
  });
}

const pluginFeatures = ["markdown", "syntax", "transformation"];
demonstratePlugins(pluginFeatures);

Python Example

def markdown_magic(content):
    """Transform markdown with ease"""
    return content.upper()

# Plugin-powered transformation
result = markdown_magic("mdx is awesome")
print(result)

Emoji Support (remark-emoji)

Coding can be fun! :computer: :smile:

Programming is an art :paintbrush: and a science :microscope:

Headings with Automatic Slugs (rehype-slug)

Headings automatically get unique identifiers for easy linking.

Nested Heading Example

You can directly link to this section using its generated slug.

Custom React Component Integration

import CustomAlert from "../components/CustomAlert";

Code Block Line Numbers

Notice how our code blocks now have line numbers thanks to rehype-prism.

Conclusion

Plugins transform markdown from simple text formatting to a powerful documentation system! :tada:
